skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...

security_audit.summary: This is an official skill from a trusted source, so a minimal audit is performed. No security concerns are flagged under the official review policy.

content.value_statement: Building a skill without structure leads to inconsistent results. This skill gives clear guidance, templates, and validation steps to create reliable skills.
actual_capabilities: Generate a new skill folder with SKILL.md and example resources using init_skill.py
Create scripts, references, and assets directories with placeholders
Validate SKILL.md frontmatter and naming rules with quick_validate.py
Package a skill into a .skill file after validation using package_skill.py
Provide workflow and output pattern guidance for skill writing
limitations: Validation checks only frontmatter format, name, and description rules
Packaging expects local filesystem access and a valid SKILL.md
Scripts require Python 3 and PyYAML installed
Does not generate final skill content or assets automatically

use_cases.title: Standardize skill creation
use_cases.description: Set a consistent template and validation flow for internal skills across multiple teams.

use_cases.title: Improve skill guidance
use_cases.description: Structure SKILL.md content with clear workflows and output patterns for better AI behavior.

use_cases.title: Publish a new skill
use_cases.description: Create, validate, and package a skill for sharing in a marketplace.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a starter skill folder
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize a new skill named data-auditor in ./skills. Then tell me the next steps to complete SKILL.md.

prompt_templates.title: Structure SKILL.md
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a clear layout plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a SKILL.md structure for a PDF editor skill with workflow sections and references files.

prompt_templates.title: Add validation rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my SKILL.md frontmatter and list changes needed to pass quick_validate.py.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare for packaging
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to run package_skill.py for ./skills/my-skill and what the output file will contain.

output_examples.input: How should I structure a skill for editing DOCX files?
output: Use a workflow-based layout with clear steps for reading, editing, and exporting
Move detailed API usage to references files to keep SKILL.md concise
Add scripts for repeated tasks like extracting tracked changes

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise and link to references for deep details
Use scripts for repeated and fragile operations
Run validation before packaging and distribution
anti_patterns: Putting large reference documents inside SKILL.md
Leaving example files that are not used by the skill

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance and scripts are platform neutral for skill authoring.

faq.question: What are the validation limits?
faq.answer: Validation focuses on frontmatter, naming rules, and basic description checks.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my repo workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Run the scripts within your repository and store skills in your chosen folders.

faq.question: Does it send data over the network?
faq.answer: No. The scripts operate on local files only.

faq.question: What if validation fails with a YAML error?
faq.answer: Check the frontmatter format and ensure the YAML block starts and ends with ---.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual skill writing?
faq.answer: It adds templates, structured guidance, and repeatable validation and packaging steps.
